variable.comment: Motor Control Algorithm, 0-8 User defined = 9 (see CV60)

Electrical Coupler Output mappng
variable.comment: Electrical Coupler Output mapping for the 1-4 outputs. Only one of the outputs can be configured as ECoupler Output

variable.label: Chip Temperature
variable.comment: Chip temperature read out (the value is expressed in degrees Celsius. The precision of the readout is +/- 2 degrees). Prior to the readout the F5 function must be switched On and Off

variable.label: Temperature Limit for the temperature protection
variable.comment: Temperature Limit for the temperature protection (value in degrees Celsius)

variable.label: Brake Distance configuration
variable.comment: Brake Distance configuration, 0-No brake, 1-15 Braking rate, the CV value influences the Constant Braking Distance, CV137=1 means the Shortest Braking Distance from maximum Speed to STOP. Increase the CV value to increase the braking distance. Distance=Value * Shortest Breaking Distance

variable.label: Brake Delay Configuration
variable.comment: CV138= 0 means no Brake Delay. To increase breaking distance above the value configured in CV138, increase in small amounts the value of CV65, which will delay the start of the braking, resulting in a longer braking path. Brake Delay = CV138 Value * 8ms (ms) Extra Distance = MaxSpeed * BrakeDelay Ex: 200ms(delay)=8(ms)*25(CV value)

factReset.label: HARD RESET all CVs reset to default values

label.text: Train-O-Matic (tOm) decoders support a decoder locking feature
useful when several decoders are used in one loco
on the same address, e.g. for adding sound
Set CV15 equal to this number to unlock the decoder for programming
